scenarios.query: Patient condition is stable and improving
scenarios.correct: Medical status shows stability with positive progress
scenarios.adversarial: Patient condition is stable and not improving
scenarios.challenge: Single word negation with high lexical overlap

scenarios.query: Treatment works in 90% of cases
scenarios.correct: Therapy demonstrates efficacy in ninety percent of patients
scenarios.adversarial: Treatment works in 9% of cases
scenarios.challenge: Single digit change with massive semantic impact

scenarios.query: Drug is safe for pregnant women
scenarios.correct: Medication poses no risk to expectant mothers
scenarios.adversarial: Drug is unsafe for pregnant women
scenarios.challenge: Single prefix changes safety profile completely

scenarios.query: Surgery is necessary before radiation therapy
scenarios.correct: Surgical intervention required prior to radiological treatment
scenarios.adversarial: Surgery is necessary after radiation therapy
scenarios.challenge: Critical temporal ordering with life-threatening implications

scenarios.query: Virus spreads through airborne transmission
scenarios.correct: Pathogen transmits via respiratory droplets in air
scenarios.adversarial: Virus spreads through waterborne transmission
scenarios.challenge: Single word changes transmission vector

scenarios.query: Increase medication dosage gradually over time for safety
scenarios.correct: Slowly escalate drug amounts progressively to ensure patient wellbeing
scenarios.adversarial: Decrease medication dosage rapidly at once for danger
scenarios.challenge: Every key concept inverted while maintaining structure

scenarios.query: Early detection significantly improves survival rates
scenarios.correct: Prompt identification substantially enhances patient longevity outcomes
scenarios.adversarial: Late detection significantly worsens death rates
scenarios.challenge: All positive concepts flipped to negative

scenarios.query: New drug prevents disease progression in all patients
scenarios.correct: Novel medication halts illness advancement across entire patient population
scenarios.adversarial: Old drug causes disease progression in no patients
scenarios.challenge: Multiple concept inversions with logical complexity

scenarios.query: High-risk patients require immediate intensive care
scenarios.correct: Critical condition individuals need urgent specialized treatment
scenarios.adversarial: Low-risk patients avoid delayed minimal care
scenarios.challenge: Risk level, timing, and care intensity all inverted

scenarios.query: This statement is always true in medical practice
scenarios.correct: The assertion consistently applies to healthcare situations
scenarios.adversarial: This statement is always false in medical practice
scenarios.challenge: Self-referential contradiction creates logical paradox

scenarios.query: All rules have exceptions except this rule
scenarios.correct: Every guideline permits deviation excluding this principle
scenarios.adversarial: All rules have exceptions including this rule
scenarios.challenge: Self-referential rule about rules creates paradox

scenarios.query: Nobody knows everything about this disease
scenarios.correct: No individual possesses complete knowledge of this condition
scenarios.adversarial: Everybody knows nothing about this disease
scenarios.challenge: Universal quantifier paradox with knowledge claims

scenarios.query: Patient temperature reading is critical
scenarios.correct: Body heat measurement indicates severe medical concern
scenarios.adversarial: Patient temperature reading is critical for diagnosis
scenarios.challenge: Same words with completely different contextual implications

scenarios.query: Treatment should be aggressive in this case
scenarios.correct: Therapy must be intensive and forceful for this patient
scenarios.adversarial: Treatment should be aggressive in this legal case
scenarios.challenge: Word 'case' shifts medical to legal context

scenarios.query: Discharge patient when symptoms resolve completely
scenarios.correct: Release individual after full symptom resolution
scenarios.adversarial: Discharge patient when symptoms resolve the conflict
scenarios.challenge: Homonymous 'resolve' changes medical to interpersonal context

scenarios.query: Treatment rarely fails to improve symptoms
scenarios.correct: Therapy typically succeeds in enhancing patient condition
scenarios.adversarial: Treatment rarely succeeds to improve symptoms
scenarios.challenge: Double negation creates hidden positive meaning

scenarios.query: Few patients lack improvement with this drug
scenarios.correct: Most individuals experience positive response to medication
scenarios.adversarial: Few patients show improvement with this drug
scenarios.challenge: Implicit negation through 'lack' reverses meaning

scenarios.query: It is impossible that this treatment is ineffective
scenarios.correct: The therapy cannot fail to provide beneficial results
scenarios.adversarial: It is impossible that this treatment is effective
scenarios.challenge: Nested impossibility creates complex logical structure

scenarios.query: If and only if symptoms persist, then increase dosage
scenarios.correct: Escalate medication amount precisely when signs continue
scenarios.adversarial: If and only if symptoms persist, then decrease dosage
scenarios.challenge: Biconditional logic with critical medical decision

scenarios.query: Either surgery or radiation, but not both, is recommended
scenarios.correct: Exclusive choice between surgical or radiological intervention
scenarios.adversarial: Either surgery or radiation, and both, is recommended
scenarios.challenge: Exclusive OR vs inclusive OR logical difference

scenarios.query: Treatment works unless patient has specific allergy
scenarios.correct: Therapy effective except in cases of particular hypersensitivity
scenarios.adversarial: Treatment works because patient has specific allergy
scenarios.challenge: Exception condition vs causal condition

scenarios.query: Future test results will confirm past diagnosis
scenarios.correct: Upcoming examination findings will validate previous medical assessment
scenarios.adversarial: Past test results will confirm future diagnosis
scenarios.challenge: Temporal causality reversal creates logical impossibility

scenarios.query: Prevention is better than cure after disease onset
scenarios.correct: Prophylactic measures exceed therapeutic value post-illness
scenarios.adversarial: Prevention is better than cure before disease onset
scenarios.challenge: Temporal logic of prevention vs treatment

scenarios.query: Every patient needs some medication for recovery
scenarios.correct: All individuals require certain drugs for healing
scenarios.adversarial: Some patient needs every medication for recovery
scenarios.challenge: Quantifier scope shift changes feasibility completely

scenarios.query: All doctors know some treatment for most diseases
scenarios.correct: Every physician understands certain therapies for majority of conditions
scenarios.adversarial: Some doctors know all treatment for most diseases
scenarios.challenge: Multiple quantifier interaction creates different claims

scenarios.query: Most symptoms appear before all complications develop
scenarios.correct: Majority of signs emerge prior to complete complication onset
scenarios.adversarial: All symptoms appear before most complications develop
scenarios.challenge: Temporal quantifier scope affects medical prediction
